scenes.location: MR. TRE'S HOUSE LIVING ROOM DAY 4
characters: VIEW OF THE ROW OF LOCKERS WHERE TAYLOR AND ZAVALA DRESS
LIPSTICK CAMERAS MOUNTED IN THE FRONT.
ZAVALA DRIVING, SMILES INTO THE HANDHELD CAMERA THAT
ZAVALA STICKS HIS FACE IN THE LENS AND WHISPERS...
LOOKING DOWN. THIS IS SHOT BY OUR FAMILIAR HOMIES...
HIDDEN CAMERAS ON THE BOYS' UNIFORMS.
REAL LIFE IT IS NOT ALL UNUSUAL FOR GANGMEMBERS TO FILM
OF FOCUS HAND TAKES NOTES IN THE FOREGROUND.
CAMERAS TAYLOR AND ZAVALA WEAR ON THEIR UNIFORMS. J
47, TAKING AIM AT THE COPS BELOW...
WORN ON TAYLOR'S AND ZAVALA'S UNIFORMS.
PAGEANTRY OF A LAW ENFORCEMENT MEMORIAL.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Clear right! Dan's voice is pumping with adrenaline...

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Watch it! Car!

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I see him. The cop car swerves around a catering truck.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Rightside? Rightside?! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Right's clear! Go, go, go! The orange Cadillac almost hits a pick-up loaded with furniture.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Whoa. Dude almost TC'ed. Taylor "calls the pursuit" into the radio. This will go on the duration of the pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Thirteen-Adam-Nine Eastbound Thirty Sixth Street passing Waverly. The Cadillac makes a hard right, disappearing from view, the cop car turns and we see the Cadillac again.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Thirteen-Adam-Nine. Southbound Raymond Avenue. From Denker.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Where's he going?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Disneyland. The Cadillac makes a hard left, the cop car follows, fishtailing a little.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Watch it. Then:

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He's running the light.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Am I clear?!

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Clear. We're clear. Go for it. The ENGINE HOWLS and the cop car catches up...

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Homie can drive. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: You're better. Watch the road. A slow car blocks their way. Taylor's voice BOOMS OVER THE PA LOUDSPEAKER...

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Pull over. Pull over. The car doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Pendejo. The cop car swings into oncoming traffic -- A near miss! They pass the unyielding driver...

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: I don't see him. There he is! The Cadillac is more distant. Zavala quickly closes the gap... EXT. SOUTH CENTRAL L.A. —- VARIOUS STREETS - CONTINUOUS 2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And so the chase goes. Turn after turn the Cadillac fighting like a sportfish at the end of a line, unable to shake the cop car... Zavala and Taylor shouting over the siren. Tires SCREECHING... Then... All the sound fades out. We're just watching the chase unfold on the dashcam. Hypnotically beautiful...

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR'S VOICEOVER
dialogues.text: I am the police. And I am here to arrest you. You have broken the law. I did not write the law. I may even disagree with the law. But I will enforcement it. I will act professionally and treat you with respect. I also expect to be treated with respect. I will not insult you. I will not brutalize you. I will only use the force necessary to stop you. I will do whatever it takes to place you in custody. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR'S VOICEOVER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I am prepared to deprive you of your freedom and if necessary your life. I will not hesitate to kill you if you endanger my life or the lives of others. If you run away I will chase you. If you fight me I will fight back. If you shoot at me I will shoot back. You are in this situation because something has gone wrong with your life. Most likely this moment has been a long time coming. As it is unlikely this moment may be an anomaly in an otherwise decent and law abiding life. I understand that factors in your life have created an easy justification for your actions. Poverty, lack of education, drug abuse, emotional and physical abuse may have conspired to rob you of the ability to obey the law. But many other people have endured and transcended much worse circumstances than the ones which have shaped your life. Yet you have made bad decisions. You are responsible for your behavior. Your actions have made you my responsibility. No matter how you plead, cajole, beg or attempt to stir my sympathies nothing you do will stop me from placing you ina steel cage with grey bars. By law I am unable to walk away. I ama consequence. I am the unpaid bill. I am fate with a badge and a gun. Behind my badge is a heart like yours. I bleed, I think, I love. And yes, I can be killed. And although I am but one man, I have thousands of brothers and sisters who are the same as me. The cop car is now very close to the Cadillac... TAYLOR'S VOICEOVER (CONT’D) They will lay down their lives for me and I them. If you succeed in stopping me, you will not succeed in stopping them. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TAYLOR'S VOICEOVER (CONT’D) We stand watch together, a thin blue line, protecting the prey from the predators. The good from the bad. We are the police. SCREEEEECH! -- The sound slams back in full force. The lyrical, eerie quality of the chase now feels dangerous and visceral. SIRENS, SQUEALING TIRES, ROARING ENGINES... EXT. SOUTH CENTRAL L.A. — INTERSECTION — CONTINUOUS 3 The cop car pulls alongside the Cadillac's bumper and does a "Pit Maneuver." The Cadillac spins out...

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Good job, Z. WHAM! -- The Cadillac CRASHES into a phonepole... SCREECH -- As the cop car slides to a stop right behind it...

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thirteen-Adam-Nine. Code six. Pursuit terminated. Suspect vehicle TC'ed. Twenty three hundred block of, uh, Forty-third Street. TWO HUGE GANGSTERS instantly spring out of the Cadillac and OPEN FIRE with handguns... TICK-TICK-TICK -- The windshield is hit...

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Gun! Gun! We HEAR the door's open...

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Thirteen-Adam-Nine. Officer needs help. Shots fired. POP-POP-POP-POP-POP-POP! -- Still OFFSCREEN Zavala and Taylor are returning fire... The two HUGE GANGSTERS are hit multiple times and drop... NOW WE SEE ZAVALA AND TAYLOR -- As they approach the gangsters, FRAMED IN DASH CAM. Two healthy young men, one White one Latino. Both are pure cop... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kick the guns away from the men. Zavala handcuffs the dead gangsters. Taylor keys his shoulder mic...

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thirteen-Adam-Nine. Code four. Both suspects are down. Requesting supervisor and an RA. We HEAR the POLICE CHOPPER overhead. The WAIL of a dozen approaching sirens... MORE COPS flood into view -- A half dozen arriving units. The gravity of the shooting now hits Taylor hard...

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Holy shit. Holy shit. Holy shit.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: You okay, partner?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Holy shit. Holy shit.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Walk it off.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: I'm good bro. Holy shit. Zavala makes the "Code 4" to the arriving officers -- The badguys are no longer a danger. OROZCO, a tough as hell female Mexican cop from the Hood, eyes the dead gangsters...

dialogues.speaker: OROZCO
dialogues.text: ---holy shit...

dialogues.speaker: CAMERAS TAYLOR AND ZAVALA WEAR ON THEIR UNIFORMS. J
dialogues.text: It's super-ghetto up in here. Black velvet paintings. Fast food wrappers. Holes punched in the walls. A shopping cart full of empty 40's. A couple car doors in the corner. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lord and master of this domicile is MR. TRE -- Six and a half feet of angry drunk gangster. Shirtless, a barrelchest full of Folsom's best ink. He is mid- argument with Taylor and Zavala...

dialogues.speaker: MR. TRE
dialogues.text: Y'all coming up in here. In my house. My house. Talking nonsense about some fool ass Chinese motherfuckin' mailman. Stealing my mail. Opening my letters. Go in his living room get my mail. Punk-ass rollers.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Sir, I appreciate you have an ongoing dispute with the your mail carrier. However. That does not justify you putting hands on him.

dialogues.speaker: MR. TRE
dialogues.text: Bitch. No such shit went down. Fool's a lying ass snitch. I'ma take my mail. I get checks. I get business correspondence. Money in the mail. He be opening that shit. I'ma take my mail from him.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Interfering with a mail carrier is a federal crime. It's a felony. This can go one of several ways. Right now it's about your attitude.

dialogues.speaker: MR. TRE
dialogues.text: I got my mail. I helped him. I helped him give my mail to me. This shit's over. Y'all can get the fuck out my house.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Sir, if you've been drinking you need to stay inside and not intimidate the mailman.

dialogues.speaker: MR. TRE
dialogues.text: You need to shut the fuck up. You didn't have that badge and gun you wouldn't be about shit. Without it you ain't shit. You don't stand for shit. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MR. TRE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're about less than motherfucking nothing. Border hopping motherfucker. Zavala hardens. Begins unsnapping the keepers on his gunbelt.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: That so? You wanna find out what I'm about? Let's settle this right here like grown men.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Partner, that's not a good idea.

dialogues.speaker: MR. TRE
dialogues.text: (incredulous) You wanna fight me?

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: I wanna fight. Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: MR. TRE
dialogues.text: I'm a whip your ass, and your partner there's gonna shoot my brains out.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Stand down, Z.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: (to Taylor) Stay out of it.

dialogues.speaker: MR. TRE
dialogues.text: I beat your ass, y'all gonna leave?

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Win or lose, I'm arresting you, Tre. You can't steal mail. But you called me out. Now I'm calling you out. What's up?

dialogues.speaker: MR. TRE
dialogues.text: Let's do this. Zavala tosses Taylor his gunbelt. Unpins his badge. Hands it to Taylor. He squares off with Mr. Tre who towers over him.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: -..Jdesus Christ... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- What follows is one of the most intense and realistic fights ever -- WHAM! -- Mr. Tre was a kickboxer back in the day. He knocks Zavala into the wall with a roundhouse... Zavala leaps up and closes with a blizzard of fists... The sickening sound of punches landing on flesh as Zavala works the inside with flurries of rabbit punches... WHAM! -- Mr. Tre kicks him again. Then follows up with his locomotive sized fists. Pounding Zavala into the carpet. Zavala is clearly overwhelmed... Taylor moving forward...

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Taylor! No! I got this. Zavala takes the punches, drops to a knee, covers up. Mr. Tre grabs his head and begins kneeing his face...

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Zz!

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Stay out. Overpowered and outgunned, Zavala stubbornly holds on. Taking blow after blow. It goes on and on... Then Mr. Tre slows. He's panting from the exertion. Chest heaving, arms burning from the effort... And that is when Zavala suddenly rises up from certain doom -- He explodes with a massive barrage of brutal hard punches... BAM-BAM-BAM-BAM! -- He works Mr. Tre up and down his body, waits for his big muscled arms to drop and when they do... SMACK-SMACK-SMACK-SMACK-SMACK-SMACK -- Zavala lights up his face, finally landing a money shot on his jaw...

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You talk it. Can you take it? Mr. Tre staggers back. Bewildered, stunned, he takes a knee and lowers his head... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MR. TRE
dialogues.text: I'm done. Much respect. He holds out his hand. Zavala shakes it. It's over. Zavala catches his breath. Taylor hands him back his badge. His gunbelt.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Z, he has visible injuries.

dialogues.speaker: MR. TRE
dialogues.text: Don't trip. I'ma say I locked it up with some dude before y'all showed up. Mr. Tre stands. Turns and holds his hands behind him to be cuffed -- As Zavala cuffs him...

dialogues.speaker: MR. TRE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You got a lotta heart for a cop.

dialogues.speaker: SUPER TITLE
dialogues.text: INT. OLYMPIC AUDITORIUM — NIGHT 5

dialogues.speaker: HANDHELD BY TAYLOR.
dialogues.text: It's the annual "Fight for Life" boxing match. LAPD Officers square off with LA County Sheriff Deputies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are tons off off-duty cops and Sheriffs and their families. Getting rowdy, rooting for their guys, drinking beers. SHOUTS and WHISTLES... Zavala waits his turn in the ring. His smoking hot wife GABBY is six months pregnant. She massages his shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: Stay loose, baby. WE DON'T SEE TAYLOR BECAUSE HE IS FILMING.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Mike. Who are you and what's going on? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: I'm Mike and I'm gonna knock a Deputy the fuck out.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: C'mon. I have to show people this. Zavala rolls his eyes, then plays along.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Okay, I'm LAPD Police Officer Two Mike Zavala and I'm going in the ring to box Deputy Arkashian. Gabby is her typically high energy and aggressive self.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: And you're gonna beat his fool ass, yeah?

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Yep-yep.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Officer Zavala, where are you from?

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: East Los, baby. City Terrace.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: How long have you been an officer?

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Bro, I gotta fight. This fool's heavy duty.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: (to Gabby) And you are?

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: Gabriela.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: That's my old lady, dude. You know that.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: When are you due? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: Three months. That's when SARGE enters the frame and throws an arm around Zavala. He's their field Sergeant, their boss. But he's a cop's cop and looks after his own.

dialogues.speaker: SARGE
dialogues.text: Zavala you're winning this, right?

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: SARGE
dialogues.text: I got money on you. I heard he took thirty days comp time to work out in Big Bear with De La Hoya's trainer.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Sarge, I'm interviewing Z for my thing.

dialogues.speaker: SARGE
dialogues.text: I'm breaking all your cameras, Taylor. (back to Z) You know he was Socal Golden Gloves champion?

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: So. I was East L.A. King Taco parking lot champion.

dialogues.speaker: LOUDSPEAKER VOICE
dialogues.text: Next up at one hundred and ninety pounds is Deputy Ivan "The Hitman" Arkashian with LASD's Special Enforcement Bureau. He'll be fighting Officer Mike "The Mangler" Zavala from LAPD Newton Patrol.

dialogues.speaker: SARGE
dialogues.text: Make us proud, Mike. Deafening CHEERS as the crowd goes nuts. Zavala heads for the ring...

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: Kick his ass, baby! Fuck him up!  13. INT. OLYMPIC AUDITORIUM —- BOXING RING — NIGHT 6

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zavala and ARKASHIAN are mid-fight trading blows. The THUMPS of the blows easily heard over the SHOUTS and WHISTLES of the pumped up crowd... Sweat flies. The blur of boxing gloves... WHAM! -- Zavala knocks out the big Armenian Deputy. He falls like a tree and bounces off the canvas... The REFEREE does a ten-count. Then grabs Zavala's gloved hand and raises it -- He's the winner... LAPD COPS CHEER -- The DEPUTIES BOOING. Zavala SEES THE CAMERA and points his free glove at it and grins...

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: LAPD! Hell to the yeah!

dialogues.speaker: SUPER TITLE
dialogues.text: INT. NEWTON DIVISION — LOCKER ROOM - DAY 7

dialogues.speaker: FOR WATCH. J
dialogues.text: Taylor looks AT CAMERA as he zips his uniform shirt.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Okay. This is my day job. Some of you may know me as Brian. Or Taylor. But here I'm Police Two Officer Brian Taylor. This is where the forces of good prepare to fight the forces of evil.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: What the hell, bro? I'm in my chones. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: That's my partner Officer Zavala. We work basic patrol here in Newton. One of the toughest divisions in LAPD.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Shootin' Newton. That's right. Taylor is showing his equipment...

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: This is the department issue side arm. The Glock forty. It holds fifteen rounds of high pressure Hydrashock loads. I have a back- up gun in this holster on my ankle. It's a Glock twenty six. I have a Spyderco knife. This little thing that can break a car window. My flashlight. Two Smith and Wesson handcuffs. Radio holder. A can of OC spray. That's pepper spray. What else? Spare magazines. Baton ring.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Are you gonna shut the fuck up and go to roll call?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Don't curse. I have to edit that out.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Fuck. Fuck. Fuck. Fuck. Now in Spanish. Pinchi. Pinchi. Pinchi.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HAUSER
dialogues.text: Having fun? An older greying 25 year veteran lands at the locker by Taylor's and hurries to get dressed. This is VAN HAUSER, burned-out, beaten down. And still punching the clock.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: This is Officer Three Van Hauser. He has twenty five years on the job. Considered unpromotable by the department. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: ..-he's the angriest cop in the World... Van Hauser spins -- Glares RIGHT AT CAMERA...

dialogues.speaker: VAN HAUSER
dialogues.text: I'm telling Sarge you're taping in here.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: It uses flash cards. It's not called taping anymore.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HAUSER
dialogues.text: Goddammit, Taylor! VAN HAUSER GRABS CAMERA -- THE SCREEN GOES BLACK. INT. NEWTON DIVISION — ROLL CALL ROOM — DAY 8

dialogues.speaker: OF FOCUS HAND TAKES NOTES IN THE FOREGROUND.
dialogues.text: It looks like a classroom with police stuff on the walls. The OFFICERS of the PM Watch sit at the tables. CAPTAIN REESE, or "The Coolest Captain Ever" as the boys call him, addresses the gathered officers. He's tall and athletic and always smiling. Nobody doubts he'll be Chief someday.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN REESE
dialogues.text: OIG is auditing response times. Acknowledge your call. Get there fast and safe. Code six as soon as you're on scene. Seconds count. If someone's closer buy the call and stop the clock. No submarining. Make Newton look good. I want to welcome back Zavala and Taylor who have been cleared by the DA for the shooting last month. We had no doubt the shooting board would recommend a return to duty. I know it's an unpleasant experience, that much scrutiny. Never forget, a good on the job shooting is still a homicide. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN REESE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It is not meant to be a pleasant ride. I will back you up if you're right. And if you're wrong, I will personally throw you under the bus. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: THE WATCH OFFICERS
dialogues.text: Yessir!

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN REESE
dialogues.text: All yours, Sergeant. The Captain exits the room. Sarge sits on the desk up front. He holds up a ticket book.

dialogues.speaker: SARGE
dialogues.text: This is called a ticket book. Inside are these things called tickets. It gets better. You can actually stop motorists and cut citations for vehicle code violations. Like running lights and speeding. There is a reason you are issued these books. All of you need to write. I know there is plenty of other fun to be had out there. But if you don't start writing the Captain will shit on me. And I will shit on you. Capiche?

dialogues.speaker: THE WATCH OFFICERS
dialogues.text: (various adlibs) Yes, Sarge -- I don't know how to write -- My dog ate my book -- -- I forgot my pen --

dialogues.speaker: SARGE
dialogues.text: Orozco and Davis, A-Twenty Five. Peterson and Washington, A-Forty One. Zavala and Taylor, you got A- Thirteen.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Sarge, that's not our area.

dialogues.speaker: SARGE
dialogues.text: A-Thirteen.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: We work Nine. That's our turf. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SARGE
dialogues.text: This isn't Monopoly, you don't get to pick your real estate. Goodbye. Go. Can you get through watch without killing anyone? THE CAMERA IS GRABBED OFF THE TABLE...

dialogues.speaker: CAR.
dialogues.text: Zavala, holding a shotgun, walking with Orozco, the tough female cop.

dialogues.speaker: OROZCO
dialogues.text: Why are you filming everything?

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: It's for his class.

dialogues.speaker: OROZCO
dialogues.text: I thought you were studying law?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Pre-law. I need an art elective. I'm taking film making.

dialogues.speaker: OROZCO
dialogues.text: Get my good side, eh?

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: You don't have a good side.

dialogues.speaker: OROZCO
dialogues.text: You know they can subpoena that shit if something goes sideways. You ought'a think twice.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Two words. Erase button.

dialogues.speaker: OROZCO
dialogues.text: Two words. Just ‘cause you guys think you're these big ghetto gunfighters now don't mean you can be dropping calls. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: That was at least two dozen words.

dialogues.speaker: OROZCO
dialogues.text: I barely got a GED. What do you expect? Orozco and her partner DAVIS, a tall blonde female, cross to their black and white. Zavala catches Taylor checking her out.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Awwww, dude. Admit it. You'd hit it.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: With a cinderblock.

dialogues.speaker: LIPSTICK CAMERAS MOUNTED IN THE FRONT.
dialogues.text: Zavala drives, Taylor does books. Zavala waves AT CAMERA. Squints at it...

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Barely notice this shit.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Told you.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Good to be back. Old lady's driving me nuts at the casa. Making me do shit.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Oh no. She actually dared ask for help around the house? Incredible. Outrageous.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Yo, just 'cause I look like the dudes at Home Depot doesn't mean I do the shit the Home Depot dudes do.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Amen. I would never actually profile you as a man who helped his wife with chores. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Shut up. And her brother's always coming over during the day to swim. I'm filling the pool in with cement.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Not personally. Because you'll hire a Home Depot dude for the task.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Her brother's lame.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Quiet today.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Don't say that. Last time you said that we whacked two gangbangers.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: You heard sarge. We'll be cool. (then) It's slow.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: The ghetto will provide. The ghetto will provide. Then, right on cue:

dialogues.speaker: DISPATCH VOICE
dialogues.text: Thirteen-Adam-Thirteen. Four fifteen woman. Four two two one Thirty Ninth Street. Code two. Incident number three two one zero one.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Thirteen-Adam-Thirteen. Roger enroute. (to Zavala) First customer of the day.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: I hope they enjoy our police service.  11 20. INT. CRACK HOUSE — DAY 11

dialogues.speaker: WORN ON TAYLOR'S AND ZAVALA'S UNIFORMS.
dialogues.text: The house is a hoarder's dream -- Bottles, garbage. Stacks of DVD players and car stereos. A distraught FEMALE CRACKHEAD digs at her arm with her nails. Eyes bugging, nose running.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE CRACKHEAD
dialogues.text: My babies are gone. I can't find my babies. Someone took my babies. I been here all night. I been with them. Someone took ‘em. Maybe when I was in the bathroom. Like quick. In and out.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Ma'am, how many children are missing and what are their ages?

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE CRACKHEAD
dialogues.text: They gone. I telling you they gone. They ain't here.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: How many children are missing?

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE CRACKHEAD
dialogues.text: Two. Boy anda girl. My little babies. Zavala looking around. Thinking this is no place for a child. He realizes her MAN FRIEND is sleeping on the couch under several ratty blankets.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Sir. Sir. Lemme see your hands. Please sit up. The man stirs. Zavala yanks off the blanket, he's in boxers and socks. Zavala checks the cushions for weapons.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Just sit up, sir. Put your hands on your knees. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Two children. A boy and a girl. How old are they? Ma'am. Ma'am? How old are the children?

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE CRACKHEAD
dialogues.text: One year old. The other be four.

dialogues.speaker: MAN FRIEND
dialogues.text: The kids okay. They with they grandma. They okay. We're good here, officer.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: We're going to check the house. Sometimes children hide. They could be hiding under a bed or in the closet.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE CRACKHEAD
dialogues.text: I been lookin'. Been looking. Looked everywhere. You go look. Wasting time. Get out there bring me my babies back.

dialogues.speaker: MAN FRIEND
dialogues.text: You forgot they with they grandma. You forgot. They okay. Something is odd going on. Zavala covers the Crackhead and her MAN FRIEND as Taylor checks the closets... TAYLOR'S CAMERA POV -- Moving down the hall. He opens a linen closet... Inside is a BABY DUCT-TAPED to its car seat. Anda LITTLE BOY also wrapped in duct-tape -- Feet and wrists bound. Layers of tape over his mouth. Both children STARING at Taylor with moist, pleading eyes... We can hear him struggling to keep his composure...

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: (into radio) Thirteen-Adam-Thirteen. Request supervisor and an RA to my location. Two juvenile males conscious breathing. Taylor carefully peels the duct-tape back from the boy's mouth. SNICK -- Taylor opens his knife-- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's okay, buddy. --cuts his hands free.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'll be right back. Taylor reenters the living room -- Bumps his crossed forearms together -- That means to handcuff the people... Zavala is on the woman in two steps -- Pulls his cuffs, spins her and has her cuffed with practiced speed...

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE CRACKHEAD
dialogues.text: Why you doing me like this? Huh?

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Remain calm. Taylor throws the Man Friend on the floor. Handcuffs him. Struggling to act professional.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: You're under arrest.

dialogues.speaker: MAN FRIEND
dialogues.text: I'm sleeping. I'm sleeping is all. The kids with they grandma.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: What's up, partner?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: I found the kids.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: And? Taylor nods for him to look. Zavala crosses.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Let the paramedics take the rest of the tape off.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE CRACKHEAD
dialogues.text: Lemme see my babies. Lemme see them.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Why are your children duct-taped in a hall closet? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The drug fog parts and the gears of memory and survival suddenly engage...

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE CRACKHEAD
dialogues.text: He did it. Put that motherfucker in jail. What he did to my babies. I'ma press charges. Taping my babies.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Shut the fuck up!

dialogues.speaker: MAN FRIEND
dialogues.text: Bitch. You a snake, foul and low. A lying snake. They was crying. They wouldn't shut up. She told me to do it. Why you call the police you stupid-ass bitch? I could'a told you they in the closet. Dumb smoker bitch.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Shut up asshole! Zavala_and Taylor want to kill these people. But they can't and they know it. Sometimes they have to protect each other from themselves...

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You good, partner. Got it under control? The SIRENS of approaching ambulance build...

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: It's under control. You, Z? Got it under control?

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Under control. Yeah. This is one of those calls that forever strips away a piece of a cop's soul. And they know it...

dialogues.speaker: THEMSELVES.
dialogues.text: A dozen members of a Blood set pass a blunt and drink beer. These guys aren't part timers, they are the real deal, laughing, joking having a good time. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Mr. Tre is just out of jail. He's circled up with FAT RAT, DJ, BLASTER and PEANUT. HOLDING THE CAMERA IS DION BUT WE WON'T SEE HIM.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Why they saying you got your ass beat by a cop?

dialogues.speaker: MR. TRE
dialogues.text: I fought the dude. Homie took his badge off and we squabbed straight up.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: But you got arrested?

dialogues.speaker: MR. TRE
dialogues.text: Not for thumpin' on one time. For disorderly 'cause a the mailman.

dialogues.speaker: BLASTER
dialogues.text: You fought a cop and they didn't put no assault on a peace officer on you?

dialogues.speaker: MR. TRE
dialogues.text: Nope. Nothing like that.

dialogues.speaker: PEANUT
dialogues.text: But he beat your black ass.

dialogues.speaker: MR. TRE
dialogues.text: Nobody beat my ass. I whupped the hell out of the dude but he was a man about it. Who saying that?

dialogues.speaker: FAT RAT
dialogues.text: You got your ass beat. Ah-hah.

dialogues.speaker: MR. TRE
dialogues.text: Shut the fuck up, Rat.

dialogues.speaker: BLASTER
dialogues.text: Now you know that's that same cop and his whiteboy partner who blasted them crabs from the park?

dialogues.speaker: MR. TRE
dialogues.text: Whaaat? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BLASTER
dialogues.text: Yeah. That's them. The crabs was in a G-ride and wrecked and came out bustin'. The po laid them out. Stretched 'em out on the sidewalk. Didn't even cover the bodies and they moms showed up and saw it.

dialogues.speaker: FAT RAT
dialogues.text: Fuck those fools. And they moms. Glad they got whacked.

dialogues.speaker: BLASTER
dialogues.text: They still niggas. LAPD still killin' niggas. That's what I'm saying. Maybe that Mexican cop acting right with you Tre, but he still out there killing niggas.

dialogues.speaker: MR. TRE
dialogues.text: Motherfucker got the right niggas so I ain't even trippin'.

dialogues.speaker: PEANUT
dialogues.text: Who that? Who car that? The gangsters watch a minivan approaching. They instinctively spread out. Sensing danger... The minivan accelerates -- Then SCREECHES to a stop. The door slides open... The gangsters scatter... POP-POP-POP-POP-POP! -- Flashes of light from the weapons being fired inside the minivan... We glimpse BLASTER returning fire with a Glock... POP-POP-POP-POP! -- As the Minivan disappears around the corner... SCREECH! -- The van takes off again...

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: They got Rat! CAMERA FINDS FAT RAT -- On his back in the dirt yard, gasping his last breath. Peanut kneels by his side. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: PEANUT
dialogues.text: Call a motherfuckin' ambulance! Rat? Rat? Hang on, dog.

dialogues.speaker: BLASTER
dialogues.text: That was the eses. I seen them, that was the eses from Curbside.

dialogues.speaker: MR. TRE
dialogues.text: Yep. It's them. Curbside's banging all over this motherfucker.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Let's go. I know where they stay. Let's get them fools. Blaster glares right at camera:

dialogues.speaker: BLASTER
dialogues.text: Turn that shit off, Dion! You stupid. CAMERA SHAKES AS IT IS SWITCHED OFF...

dialogues.speaker: THEMSELVES COMMITTING CRIMES.
dialogues.text: Four Homeboys from CURBSIDE LOCOTES GANG -- DEMON, WICKED, BIG EVIL. Their homegirl LA LA is driving.

dialogues.speaker: DEMON
dialogues.text: You almost ran the light stupid. You're gonna get us pulled over.

dialogues.speaker: LA LA
dialogues.text: I gotta be at work. You better not bust out. Wasting my time.

dialogues.speaker: WICKED
dialogues.text: Hell no. I'm killin' all these motherfuckin' niggers. Gonna have their brains hanging out.

dialogues.speaker: BIG EVIL
dialogues.text: Eh, La La. When are you gonna fuck the homeboy? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LA LA
dialogues.text: I'm not fucking the homeboy. I look like those little paisa hoochies you guys kick it with? I put in real work.

dialogues.speaker: DEMON
dialogues.text: I seen you looking at the homeboy.

dialogues.speaker: LA LA
dialogues.text: Whatevers.

dialogues.speaker: DEMON
dialogues.text: Wachale. Slow up. This is the street. The three gangsters pull blue rags over their faces... KERCHACK! -- Weapons are cocked...

dialogues.speaker: BIG EVIL
dialogues.text: Trucha, homie. They might have fools posted up.

dialogues.speaker: DEMON
dialogues.text: Right there. Right there. That's them. Mira mira mira. Alli van. Go, ma! La La hits the gas then hits the brakes when they reach the target...

dialogues.speaker: BIG EVIL
dialogues.text: I'm smoking all these fuckin' mayates. The sliding door is opened -- Guns are raised... POP-POP-POP-POP-POP! -- The homies unload a fusillade of bullets...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zavala driving. Taylor enters license plate numbers into the computer...

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: She's smart. She's the first girl I can actually have a conversation with. You know she has Master of Science in Fluid Hydraulics? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Fluid Hydraulics? Dang, partner. You just handed me a blank check. But because you seem to like this broad I'm going to give you a pass.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: I date all these girls. Smoking hot.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: All your little badge bunnies?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: I got laid without a badge, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: I believe you. I do. In the Marines. Don't ask don't tell?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: There's a pattern. An M.O. here. First date and a respectful kiss. Second date, a nice dinner, then full carnal knowledge. Third date's dinner and uncomfortable silences when I try and discuss anything of merit. Then it's two or three bootycalls and it's on to the next.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: I went to my prom and got married a week later. I ain't tapped nobody but Old Faithful for like eight years. Don't know what you're tripping about, dude.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: I want someone to talk to. Not just sleep with.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: White people always get hung up on all that soulmate bullshit. Just hook up with some fine-ass broad that can cook and wants kids. A bitch that's down for you, won't fuck your friends and you're straight. You're the smartest dude I know. For real. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You ain't gonna find a bad-ass chick who's as smart as you.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: You're so full of shit. You talk to Gabby? I mean real conversations. You care what she has to say, right?

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Yeah, we rap all the time, man. Gabby's a trip. You should hear the shit that comes out of her mouth. She could be the fuckin' president. She's like way smarter than me.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: See what I mean? That's all I want.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: I'll kill you if you touch her.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: What's this chick's name?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Janet. She's kind'a the complete package. We're going out again.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Saturday's my little sister's quincefiera, wanna cruise through with Janet from another planet? Shit's gonna be hardcore Mexican, you know how my familia rolls.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Maybe. Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: I wanna check her out. Suddenly the emergency CODE THREE TONES come from the radio...

dialogues.speaker: DISPATCH VOICE
dialogues.text: Thirteen-Adam-Twenty Five. Shooting in progress. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DISPATCH VOICE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thirty nine twenty Avalon Avenue. One male down. Multiple gunshot wounds. Suspect vehicle described as a white minivan. Last seen fleeing at a high rate of speed Westbound on Thirty Ninth Street. Suspects described as Hispanic female driver and three Hispanic males with shaved heads and dark clothing. Code three incident two one zero four one.

dialogues.speaker: OROZCO'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Thirteen-Adam-Twenty Five. Enroute. Code three.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Wish that was our call.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Address is Mr. Tre's house.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Shooters gotta be from Curbside. Been heating up.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: I bet the Bloods are enroute time now for some payback.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: We'll beat 'em there, bro. Zavala guns the engine and flips a tight U-turn. They race toward the Curbside neighborhood...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zavala slowly cruising along the neat little houses in the working class Latino street. Lots of CHILDREN play in yards. Zavala makes eye contact with a MOM watching her kids...

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: (subtitled Spanish) Ma'am, get your kids inside. Right now. Now is not a good time for them to be outside, understand? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Mom understands perfectly. She quickly shepherds her five kids inside. The car pulls alongside a group of TEENAGE HOMEBOYS and HOMEGIRLS gathered around a custom car. One of the kids, who we'll see again is CASPER a basically decent charismatic 13 y.o.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Casper. All of you. Go inside. It's after curfew.

dialogues.speaker: CASPER
dialogues.text: C'mon Officer Taylor. It's my pad, dude. We're not drinking or nothing.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Fine. Keep standing around. Because a P.B. Blood is dead on the ground from a drive-by shooting. What do you think is going to happen next? The kids trade looks. And quickly melt away to their houses. JUMP CUT -- MINUTES LATER... Word has gotten out. The street is now empty. Doors are closed. The previously vibrant neighborhood is on lock- down in anticipation of the Blood's retaliation. Zavala and Taylor are parked, lights off. Watching the streets...

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Partner. Zavala points out a suspicious car a couple blocks away... The car must have spotted the black and white -- It does a U-turn and exits the area...

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Let's check him out. Zavala pulls out. Then -- The EMERGENCY TONES interrupt the regular radio chatter...

dialogues.speaker: DISPATCH VOICE
dialogues.text: Thirteen-Adam-Thirteen. Two- eleven in progress. Thrifty Mart. Forty-forty-one Adams. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DISPATCH VOICE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No suspect description. Code three incident four two seven nine eight one.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: We're on. (into mic) Thirteen-Adam-Thirteen. Enroute code three. Zavala flips on the LIGHTS and SIREN. Peels out of there in the opposite direction of the suspicious vehicle...

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wonder who that was. Get the plate?

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: No. My gut's saying it's the Bloods.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: It's ping-pong. Back and forth. Back and forth.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: It's all good. I think we just stopped something, man.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Hope so, bro. Clear right.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO BLACK
dialogues.text: A TITLE CARD READS: “CINDY'S QUINCENERA" INT. SOCIAL HALL — NIGHT 16

dialogues.speaker: FOOTAGE, CELLPHONE AND HANDHELD VIDEO.
dialogues.text: CINDY is Zavala's 15 y.o. baby sister and this is her party. There are lots of TEENAGERS, the girls in matching purple dresses, the guys in white zootsuits and fedoras. This is the Latino equivalent of a cotillion. The hall packed with Zavala's extended family, all in suits and evening dresses. Zavala dances a Waltz with Cindy in her puffy purple dress. Now Taylor dances with Cindy, both looking embarrassed...  17 33. INT. SOCIAL HALL — NIGHT (LATER 17 AT A TABLE -- Zavala, Gabby, Taylor and JANET talk over the loud music. Janet is petite, very pretty and a bit of a geek. She's every bit Taylor's match.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Pretty much everyone here's family. Cousins, Aunts and Uncles and my Cousin's Cousins. Hang out long enough and you'll see someone throw up. You'll see a fight. It's all good.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: I'm Irish. It's the same thing. Everyone stays married forever. Everyone has a big family, lots of kids. Cases of beer on Saturday and Church on Sunday. They drink way too much, get in fistfights. But you mess with one of us, you'll have the whole family after you.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: I like her, Brian. She'll fit right in.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Uh, okay.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: What do you do Gabby?

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: I teach first graders for the school district. So dealing with a bunch of cops is easy for me.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: You know I never dated a cop before.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: Good. That's a good sign. You'll get used to it. Sort of. RE: Gabby's swollen belly.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: Your first? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: Can I touch it?

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: Go for it. He kicks a lot. Feel that?

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: Omigod.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: You believe that? Married four years and we're only on our first kid.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: My sister's got five. No thank you. I'm not a baby machine.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: How long have you known Brian?

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: Three years. He and Mike went to the academy together. If you wanna take notes I can give you the lowdown.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: No. Gabby. No. I thought we were cool.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: We are. This is lady talk. We gotta look out for each other the way you guys have each others backs. Go get another beer. ZAVALA GRABS THE CAMERA AND SPEAKS INTO IT CLOSE UP...

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: We now have a hen party in progress. Officer Taylor and me are now going to the bar and talking shit.  18 19 35. INT. SOCIAL HALL — NIGHT (LATER 18 Everyone does the Chicken Dance -- CAMERA FINDS: Taylor and Janet having a great time together. He likes this girl. There's chemistry.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Of Taylor and Janet slow dancing together. They smile at each other. Close their eyes and kiss -- Long and open mouthed. Taylor cracks an eye. LOOKS ANGRILY AT CAMERA:

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Seriously? Z. C'mon. Zavala's LAUGHING shakes the camera as he turns it off. LATER -- It's the end of the night. Gabby is filming Zavala and Taylor, both have had plenty of beer and are in full on "I love you, man" mode.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: You're like my fucking brother man. My brother's a piece of shit. I trust you with my life.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Me too. I couldn't work with anyone else. We can read each other's mind. I know what you're going to do before you do it. GABBY SPINS THE CAMERA ON HERSLEF AND JANET...

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: See, girl. This is the part where they make out. I ain't gonna lie. I get jealous sometimes. You're driving right?

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: I'll take him home.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. TAYLOR'S APARTMENT — BEDROOM — DAWN 19 The next morning. The sun is just rising. Janet looks into Taylor's camera, nervous. Still in the same dress.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: Hi Brian. Look it's you... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crashed in his bed. She returns the camera to its original position.

dialogues.speaker: JANET, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I can't believe I spent the night. Brace yourself. But this is the first time I've done this. Ever. I don't mean, like sex. You're number two. Uh, erase that part. I've been going through your wallet. I hope you don't mind. Sorry, I'm naturally curious. Gotta like a guy who has a picture of mom. She holds up a picture of Brian's mom. Then she holds up a paper with phone numbers and female names.

dialogues.speaker: JANET, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So about Kirsten, Mia, Racquel, etcetera. Yeah. You won't be needing them anymore. Now this is interesting. She holds up his off-duty gun.

dialogues.speaker: JANET, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I've never shot one. Maybe that can be our next date? She purses her lips and sighs. She has something hard to say.

dialogues.speaker: JANET, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay. Here's the deal, Brian Taylor. I like you a lot. I mean a lot. And it's not because your this big bad cop. It's in spite of it. I don't do this. I don't do guys. Like dating. I've spent the last six years reading engineering papers. I'm all or nothing. And I am falling really hard for you and it's really scaring me. But I can't play games. And I can't hang out and pretend to have a good time if I don't know exactly where I stand. Ready? Sit down. I love you Brian Taylor and if you don't think you will feel the same way someday then walk away now. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JANET, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You won't have to say a thing. I won't hold it against you and I will move on. Take your time. Think about it. Here's your chance to make the easiest getaway ever. But if you want more. If you want me. I mean if you really want me. Then let me know. She smiles. So beautiful, so vulnerable. She kisses the lens, leaving a lipstick print. She gets up to leave--

dialogues.speaker: JANET, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bye. --TURNING THE CAMERA OFF.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. SOUTH CENTRAL L.A. — ALLEY -— DAY 20

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're looking at the white minivan the homies from Curbside used in the drive-by. It has been burned and is still smoking. Zavala is intently checking the ground for clues. Taylor narrates:

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: This is what we believe may be the code thirty seven vehicle used in the drive-by last week. It fits the description and comes back as stolen. And you can see the steering column has been ripped open. Gangmembers like these vehicles because they blend in and you can put a lot of people in them. This door slides back and the gangmembers open up. The victim was a male black gangmember from a Blood set that has basically been at war with this Hispanic gang over control of narcotics sales. Zavala shining his light into the van.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Partner. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CAMERA FINDS -- Several shellcasings on the floor of the vehicle.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Those are shell casings. Detectives told us that three different weapons were used and we're seeing at least two kinds of shells. CAMERA PANS ONTO -- An unmarked Crown Vic pulling up and two HOMICIDE DETECTIVES get out in their starched shirts and silk ties.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: These are the Homicide Detectives working the case.

dialogues.speaker: HOMICIDE DETECTIVE 1
dialogues.text: The Hell's this? Candid camera?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: No, sir. It's a project I'm working on.

dialogues.speaker: HOMICIDE DETECTIVE 1
dialogues.text: Matches our wit statements.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: There's forty five and nine millimeter shellcasings inside.

dialogues.speaker: HOMICIDE DETECTIVE 2
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? How do you know that? You grab 'em and measure them with calipers? You touch them? You contaminate the vehicle?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Nossir.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: We found it. We called you.

dialogues.speaker: HOMICIDE DETECTIVE 1
dialogues.text: The big dogs are here now. So put up some yellow tape and stay on the other side. We'll whistle if we want anything.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Okay, sir. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Zavala and Taylor walking away from the van as the detectives check it out. TAYLOR TURNS THE CAMERA ON HIMSELF. He really wishes he was a detective.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Okay. We'll guard the crime scene while the detectives and criminalists do their CSI thing. Zavala squeezes into the shot grinning...

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Homicide detectives are cool. They have fancy ties and two hundred dollar shoes. If we're good they might let us get them coffee-- JUMP CUT -- Yellow tape surrounds the van. The two Detectives and a CRIMINALIST finish up. A tow truck stands by to impound the vehicle.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: It's been two hours and we're still waiting for the Detectives to release the scene so we can go back on patrol. HE SWINGS THE CAMERA ON A BORED ZAVALA.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Comfortable footwear. Policing is all about comfortable footwear. They stand there. Looking like a couple little kids in time out. Zavala leans against their black and white.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, what happened to homegirl with the hydraulics? Janet? A beat.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: You know. She started making cow eyes at me. And, uh... You know just, uh, trying to institute rules and regulations.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: That why you've been acting like a little bitch? (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Didn't wanna give up the candy for something real, huh? I know you. Crawl back to her on your hands and knees, dude. Pray she takes you back.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: ..-what ev's... A black and white pulls up. It's Van Hauser -- The angriest cop in the World. He's riding with a female Korean ROOKIE.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Officer Van Hauser. Good evening.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HAUSER
dialogues.text: Sarge said I should relieve you guys so you can go be the street gods you are.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: I'm down with that.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Officer Van Hauser, have you made a difference today? Van Hauser gets out of the car with a scowl, he barks at his Rookie:

dialogues.speaker: VAN HAUSER
dialogues.text: Get out. Watch the street. Make sure no assholes walk up and kill us. Now he points AT CAMERA: VAN HAUSER (CONT’D) Turn that goddamn camera off.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: It's off.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HAUSER
dialogues.text: It's off?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: It's off. Taylor is a pretty good liar. Van Hauser leans against his unit, crosses his arms. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: VAN HAUSER
dialogues.text: I see you guys trying to be good little company men, doing the Lord's work. You have your nose up the command's ass. You're out here doing whatever it is you think you're doing. Making a difference as you call it. It's all fun and games. You get to run jump fight and shoot. Well one day, and mark my words. One day the LAPD is going to bend you over your black and white and fuck you up the ass. They will fuck you so long and so hard you'll want to eat your gun just to make it stop. And if you don't do it and the fucking somehow stops, they'll punish you for not eating your gun. They'll give you freeway therapy by assigning you to Devonshire daywatch. So you spend two hours on the freeway everyday thinking about the fucking they gave you. I was just like you Taylor. Exactly like you. Making a difference. At least the bad guys attack from the front. The department sneaks up from the rear. Watch your six. CAMERA catches the mortified expression of the young Rookie who overheard all that. Zavala grins and pulls a clear bottle from his pocket...

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: I'm ready. It may say Purell. But it's really K.Y. Taylor cracks up laughing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zavala and Taylor sit in the shade of a tree watching the neighborhood. Taylor uses a pair of binoculars. Sarge pulls alongside.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: C'mon Sarge, we're staking out Curbside. They're gonna spot your unit. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SARGE
dialogues.text: You think they don't know you're here? Van Hauser wants to file a complaint on you, Taylor.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: The USS Van Hauser? LAPD's stealthiest submarine, only surfaces at the end of watch?

dialogues.speaker: SARGE
dialogues.text: He went through the academy before you were born so show a little respect. He said you were videotaping him. I warned you about that shit.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: I was documenting a crime scene.

dialogues.speaker: SARGE
dialogues.text: Just consider the wisdom of what you're doing. The video camera has not been good to this department.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: I understand, sarge.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Yo. Why's Van Hauser such a bitter dude? If he hates pushing a black and white so much why don't he leave his badge on the Watch Commander's desk and go home?

dialogues.speaker: SARGE
dialogues.text: I didn't tell you this. He was programmed to pull the pin a couple years ago. He's got three divorces under his belt so his Margins were pretty slim. Turns out marriage three-point-oh cratered because he was tapping a little mommy from right around here and knocked her up. He's gotta keep working to pay for the kid. He'll end up doing thirty and giving away his pension to a lot of outstretched hands. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: ...damnnnnn...

dialogues.speaker: SARGE
dialogues.text: That's not for broadcast. Have some empathy for the man. And Taylor, I'm entering in my log I verbally counseled you about the cameras.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Okay, Sarge. My bad. Sarge pulls away. Zavala and Taylor trade looks.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That explains so much.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Hope he don't get his rookie pregnant. Then we'll never get rid of him. Gonna put your stupid cameras away now?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: No. Taylor lifts his binocs. Watching the street. A fancy pick-up truck stops at a house. A big MEXICAN COWBOY gets out. A WOMAN exits the house and gives hima heavy pot, presumably of soup...

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Isn't that Big Evil's mom?

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Yep. Who's the cowboy?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: He's got money. See that truck? I'm running it. Zavala is already pulling out. Taylor doesn't have to say anything. Up ahead the pick-up pulls out. The black and white falls in behind it.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Wanna jam this fool? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Yes I do. Plates are clean.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Our PC's that stupid CD hanging from the rearview mirror obstructing his vision? Let's see if he'll run.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Let's do it. He switches on the lights, gives the siren a quick WHOOP.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: C'mon fucker. Run from us. Run fucker. The pick-up pulls over.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Thirteen-Adam-Thirteen. Traffic stop. Forty two hundred block of Waverly. Four Boy seven three one two. Black Ford pick-up. Taylor and Zavala trade looks, exit the vehicle... EXT. SOUTH CENTRAL L.A. — WAVERLY STREET — DAY 22

dialogues.speaker: HIDDEN CAMERAS ON THE BOYS' UNIFORMS.
dialogues.text: Zavala approaches the Cowboy, Taylor hangs back covering him.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Habla Ingles o Espanol?

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: Hablo Espanol.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Le estamos deteniendo porque tiene un CD colgado en su espejo. Salte de vehiculo por favor.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: Chinga tu madre! The Cowboy raises _a chrome .45 Pistol... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: With his boxer's reflexes Zavala bats the gun aside right as the Cowboy fires... BAM! -——

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Gun! Zavala grabs the gun with both hands... Taylor pulls his weapon -- SMASHES the passenger window of the pick-up with his Glock and screws it into the Cowboy's ear...

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Suelta la pistola o te vuelo los sesos! The Cowboy knows he's been had. And drops his pistol... Zavala rips his door open and hauls the man to the ground and cuffs him. Taylor sees no one else is in the truck. He keys his mic...

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thirteen-Adam-Thirteen. Man with a gun. Shots fired. Code four. One in custody. Request a supervisor. To Zavala:

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You good, partner? Any holes in you?

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: No. I got him, toss the truck. Zavala picks up the man's custom pistol -- Diamond encrusted with ivory grips.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dude's burner has bigger diamonds than the old lady's wedding ring. (to the Cowboy) De donde eres?

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: Come verga puto. Taylor takes the lid off the big soup pot. Sees it's full of exactly that -- soup. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He picks it up. Sets it on the street. Tips it over with his boot -- Soup spills everywhere -- As do several packs of plastic wrapped $100 bills. Taylor returns to the truck -- His face turns white. He takes something out he hadn't seen before and holds it up so Zavala can see...

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Partner. It's a gold plated AK-47...

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Big money. Big guns. Homie's a player. Orozco and Davis pull up...

dialogues.speaker: OROZCO
dialogues.text: Save anything for us?

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Check it out. Dude's packin' Liberace's AK. Taylor takes a cellphone from the truck and scrolls through the numbers... INT. NEWTON DIVISTON — REPORT WRITING ROOM -— NIGHT 23

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taylor and Zavala write up the paperwork on the arrest. The money and weapons on the table before them. Taylor holds up the Cowboy's chrome .45 and the stack of cash...

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Here we have two of the major foodgroups. Money. And guns.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: More than I make in a year right there, partner. Taylor holds up a property booking form TO CAMERA...

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: This is how the department runs. This is the lifeblood of our organization. Paper work. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Hours of it.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: The way red corpuscles carry oxygen through the body, paperwork carries information through the department.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: What's a corpuscle? Captain Reese enters. Taylor and Zavala tense.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN REESE
dialogues.text: Gentlemen.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA/TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Good evening, sir.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN REESE
dialogues.text: So this is it? Quite some hardware. Captain Reese picks up the gold AK. CAPTAIN REESE (CONT’D) Keep taking guns off the street. Then: CAPTAIN REESE (CONT’D) Carry on. Captain Reese exits. Taylor watching him go.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: You love him.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Women want him. Men want to be him.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: You want him.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: I'm not gay but I'd go down on him if he asked. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Sometimes I don't know when you're kidding. I gotta know when you're kidding.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: I'm not kidding.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Not cool. I gotta know. Taylor checks his watch. Suddenly stands...

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: I'm out of here. Taking Janet to the Philharmonic.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Ah-ha, motherfucker! How bad did you have to kiss her ass for being a dick? Knew you'd go back.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Bye.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Later. Enjoy your white people shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's 2 A.M. on one of those rare quiet nights. Zavala driving as usual. Taylor does books. Enters plates in the computer.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: How did you know you were gonna marry Gabby?

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: She told me.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: No for real. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: I was just a stoner working at my Uncle's muffler shop. One day she grabs me by the shoulders and tells me we're getting married and I'm joining the department because I can make a lot money without a college degree. I was like "okay."

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: But you love her. I've never heard you say a bad word about her. You guys never fight. You're happy together.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: All of the above. I'm just telling you how it went down. I dunno. I popped her cherry in High School. She's never been with anyone else. I never wanted anyone else. Ain't even kissed another chick since we hooked up. It was easy. It's always been easy.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Things are getting super serious with Janet.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: You just found out? That in the paper today or something? Homegirl owns your ass.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: She wants to move in. She's always over. Why spend the money on two apartments?

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: It ain't about money, dude.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Her parents are very traditional. They will go ballistic if she does. But at least we can tell them we're engaged.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Yo. Hold up. Don't play with that. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You don't ask some broad to marry you ‘cause her folks are old school. Think about this shit. Then think about it again. You're chill. You're not a partier. But marriage is forever. That's making a promise before God.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: ...I know... (then) I'm scared shitless.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: My grandma who's like deep, dude. She's like seen it all. Okay. When me and Gabby got engaged she asked me one thing. Wanna hear it?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Let's hear it.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: She asked me if I could live without her. And if the answer was yes to forget her.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Right, dude? That's some deep ass shit. Think about it.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: I am. Then:

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Make a right. We got a fire.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Where? -- Oh shit. A large craftsman home is on fire.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: (into mic) Thirteen-Adam-Thirteen. We're Code Six on a structure fire. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Six three one Twenty Sixth Street. You better send fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zavala pulls up to the burning house -- It's nicely framed in the DASH CAM... A_WOMAN comes running out with her hair smoking SHRIEKING at the top of her lungs... Zavala and Taylor jump out. Zavala grabs the fire extinguisher form the trunk... FSSSSSSH! -- He douses the Woman...

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: My babies are in there! My babies are in there! CRASH! -- A window breaks from the heat. Taylor and Zavala have mortified expressions...

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: In the bedroom upstairs. Zavala looks at Taylor--

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Z! No! --and runs inside the inferno -- Taylor runs in after him...

dialogues.speaker: LNOTE
dialogues.text: Dark with black smoke. The fire ROARS. Flashes of bright flame... MOVING UPSTAIRS -- Brighter flame. Denser smoke... Now crawling on their hands and knees. Flame overhead. The smoke is an opaque moving wall... Sounds of GROANING wood. Breaking GLASS... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: INTO A BEDROOM -- Children's toys. A _bed with two TWIN BOYS in it -- Hiding terrified under a blanket... Arms grab them... CAMERA POV RACING out of the house...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Woman is delighted as Zavala and Taylor race out each carrying a Twin...

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: You got the twins! Where's my baby girl?

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Lady you got more kids?

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: My girl. She's two. Zavala and Taylor run back inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's worse -- Dense black smoke... They race upstairs... Now on their hands and knees. Bright flame. Terrible smoke. They're COUGHING... Into the kid's room -- Toys are now melting!! They find the other bed -- The blanket smoldering... It's empty!

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Let's go! Zavala checks under the bed -- The scared LITTLE GIRL underneath it stares back at him... Zavala snatches her up and runs... Taylor follows... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CRASH! -- A window breaks -- The children's room flashes over with a camera blinding explosion... EXT. BURNING HOUSE -— NIGHT 29 A firetruck rolls up with blaring SIRENS... Zavala and Taylor exit the house and collapse in the yard. The Woman CRIES with joy. Her daughter is alive. TWO FIREMEN come running, throw fire blankets on Taylor and Zavala's smoking uniforms...

dialogues.speaker: RESCUE.
dialogues.text: A shot of Firemen knocking down the massive flames with hoses. Now a shot of Taylor and Zavala breathing oxygen in their T-shirts as they sit on the bumper of an LAFD ambulance. Now a shot of the REPORTER doing her stand-up. It is much later. Firemen rolling up hoses in B.G.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: Two LAPD officers are being hailed as heroes tonight after rescuing three children from a burning home in South Central Los Angeles tonight. The officers, who the department has yet to identify, are being held overnight for observation. The three children have been transported to Children's Medical Center and are listed in good condition with minor smoke inhalation and minor burns. It is expected they will make a full recovery. Roger, Michelle, back to you in the newsroom.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. NEWTON — ROLL CALL ROOM — DAY 31

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: It's packed with COPS -- All shapes, sizes and ranks. Half the Station's people are here. Civilian employees too. They are waiting for something... Sarge runs into the room--

dialogues.speaker: SARGE
dialogues.text: Here they come! A beat later Zavala and Taylor enter...

dialogues.speaker: EVERYONE
dialogues.text: Welcome back! They look like deer in the headlights. They smile that tight smile when you're caught offguard... Captain Reese steps up and shakes hands with them...

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN REESE
dialogues.text: Gentlemen you're a credit to not just Newton but the entire department. I wanted to let you know the Chief called me this morning. Both of you are going to receiving the Medal of Valor. Congratulations. Zavala and Taylor's stunned looks say it all...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zavala drives. Taylor keeps books. They seem quiet and reflective.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: You feel like a hero?

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Me neither. What's a hero feel like?

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: I dunno. You know me and Gabby got in a huge fight over the fire. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: You didn't tell me that.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: She was mad I could'a died for someone else's kid and mine hasn't even been born. She's like "you're not a fireman."

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Janet said the same thing. I keep having this dream I'm on fire and trapped in the house and I go to open the door and the two gangbangers we shot are standing there aiming guns at me and my holster's empty.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Jeeezus, dude.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: I don't think I can go in another burning house. I only went in because you did.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: I didn't even think about it. Started shaking in the hospital. Gabby came in the room and started crying right away.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: I don't want a medal. I just want to forget it happened. Let's get in a gunfight or something fun. They bump fists:

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: I'm right there, bro.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Remember the cowboy with the blinged out AK?

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Yep. He's probably my Cousin.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: I crisscrossed some phone numbers in his cell. Couple addresses are in our basic area. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: You're not a detective.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: That guy's something and he's into something. DA didn't buy the ADW. Only filed on the weapons beef. G- Unit says they'll get to him but they're too busy. Narcs aren't interested because we didn't find dope.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: You're not a detective.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: I want to be a detective.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Wannabe. You said it.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. BOARDED UP HOUSE — DAY 33 Taylor and Zavala get out and approach the house. The yard is dead. The window's covered with plywood.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Abandoned property?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Maybe. Look at all the locks on the door. He checks the side of the house SEES piles of garbage bags. Rips one open -- Paper plates spill out. He slashes open more bags -- All full of paper plates and plastic cups.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Partner. Someone have a party? Squatters?

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Food's all fresh.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: This is weird. Taylor crosses to a plywood cover window. Shines his flashlight into a gap. Then... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Ayudenos por favor!

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: (into mic) Thirteen-Adam-Thirteen. Code six. Nine thirty one Fifty Third Street. Requesting additional unit. Zavala POUNDS on the front door.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Policia! Abren la puerta! Policia! The inner door opens -- A TALL COWBOY -- Stands behind the heavy iron gate. Zavala's and Taylor's antennas are raised. With his heavy accent:

dialogues.speaker: TALL COWBOY
dialogues.text: It's okay. It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Abre la puerta.

dialogues.speaker: TALL COWBOY
dialogues.text: It's okay. Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Vamos a tumbar la puerta si no abres.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Fuck this guy. Taylor draws his Glock and aims at the man through the door... The Tall Cowboy reluctantly unlocks the three deadbolts and steps aside.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sus manos. Levanta las manos. If looks could kill this Cowboy's expression would be lethal -- He's clearly a bad guy. The two ounce gold pistol hanging form his neck doesn't give the warm fuzzies...  34 35 58. INT. BOARDED UP HOUSE -— DAY 34 Zavala draws his piece and moves inside. From OFFSCREEN:

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Hook him up! Taylor steps in. Zavala has his gun on the Cowboy. Taylor spins him -- Revealing a_ magnum tucked in the small of the man's back.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Gun. Taylor takes the man's gun, shoves it in his belt. Cuffs the man. Searches him. Finds another gun clipped to his ostrich skin boot. Then a huge wad of cash in an AK-47 shaped money clip in his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (into radio) Thirteen-Adam-Fifteen. We have one in custody with a gun. Taylor shoves him to the floor face down.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Partner. Zavala nods for him to look. Taylor turns and his face falls... The house is packed with 50 ILLEGAL IMMIGRANTS -- They have just found a safe house for human trafficking. Orozco and Davis arrive. Looking pissed...

dialogues.speaker: OROZCO
dialogues.text: Why you guys poaching in our area? She enters the house and sees the mass of miserable scared people, Men, Women, Children...

dialogues.speaker: OROZCO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Omigod.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. BOARDED UP HOUSE — DAY 35 Taylor and Zavala and an ICE AGENT do stacks of paperwork on the hood of a black and white. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Behind them the Immigrants are searched and processed by a half-dozen ICE AGENTS.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: This is the second Cowboy like this we've run into.

dialogues.speaker: ICE AGENT
dialogues.text: Watch out for these guys. They are bad, bad actors.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: I know I'm just a street cop but I'd like a heads up here.

dialogues.speaker: ICE AGENT
dialogues.text: We have indicators this guy's a footsoldier for the Sinaloa Cartel.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: We didn't get any hits when we ran him.

dialogues.speaker: ICE AGENT
dialogues.text: You're not privy to our databases. Cartel people are operating here. And we're watching. You don't have the proper clearance to hear more than that. Be careful with these guys.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: ICE AGENT
dialogues.text: It means they're major players and you and your homeboy need to power down. The Ice Agent walks away -- Zavala and Taylor trade looks.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: ...Feds...

dialogues.speaker: THEMSELVES.
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A house party is in full swing. The music BUMPS. We recognize Big Evil, Wicked, La La, Demon. There's a dozen YOUNG HOMIES and a plethora of HOODRATS and FINE MAMIS. Demon rolls a blunt. Watching a Young Homie do the "Crip Walk." Big Evil waves over a VERY PRETTY GIRL. Hands her a plastic cup of beer. Innocence in the lion's den.

dialogues.speaker: BIG EVIL
dialogues.text: C'mere, baby doll. Drink the Jim Jones.

dialogues.speaker: VERY PRETTY GIRL
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: DEMON
dialogues.text: Eh, you like coke?

dialogues.speaker: VERY PRETTY GIRL
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: DEMON
dialogues.text: You ever fucked on heroin?

dialogues.speaker: VERY PRETTY GIRL
dialogues.text: Yeah right.

dialogues.speaker: DEMON
dialogues.text: I can fuck forever on that shit. I'll eat your pussy for hours.

dialogues.speaker: VERY PRETTY GIRL
dialogues.text: You guys are crazy.

dialogues.speaker: LA LA
dialogues.text: Turn around, mija. Let me check out the nalgas. The Pretty Girl does. Adlibs of "Damn" from the Cholos.

dialogues.speaker: LA LA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Get with me, yeah. These fools just wanna hit it and quit it. I'll make you my lady. Buy you shit.

dialogues.speaker: WICKED
dialogues.text: Buy her a fuckin' raspado at the swap meet.

dialogues.speaker: LA LA
dialogues.text: Shut-up. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: La La pulls out a huge wad of cash.

dialogues.speaker: LA LA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Louis Vuitton. Jimmy Chu's. C'mere, mamita. La La grabs her hand and pulls her onto her lap. Plants on a long kiss.

dialogues.speaker: DEMON
dialogues.text: Aw, hell no. Suddenly a LOOKOUT comes running into the back...

dialogues.speaker: LOOKOUT
dialogues.text: Alli viene la jura!

dialogues.speaker: BIG EVIL
