dialogues.text: Hide the fuscas, perrito. Big Evil, Demon and La La quickly hand him their guns. The Lookout scrams, disappearing through a hole in the fence... Taylor, Zavala, Orozco and Davis come walking into the back.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Hide the guns. Hide the dope. The jura's here.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: What's the occasion?

dialogues.speaker: BIG EVIL
dialogues.text: Just kicking back sir. Everything's under control. La La lights a blunt. Orozco glares at her.

dialogues.speaker: OROZCO
dialogues.text: Have some respect, La La. Don't smoke in front of us.

dialogues.speaker: LA LA
dialogues.text: Take a hit. Shit'll chill you out, Malinche. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: OROZCO
dialogues.text: You even know who the Malinche was?

dialogues.speaker: LA LA
dialogues.text: She was an 0.G. paisa. When Hernan Cortes came with the Spanish soldiers to conquer the Aztecs she helped him, she became his old lady and betrayed her own people. Like you.

dialogues.speaker: OROZCO
dialogues.text: No La La. Like you. Gangbanging. Slanging. Making this a bad place for kids to live.

dialogues.speaker: LA LA
dialogues.text: I enjoy your theories. You know you want this. La La gestures at her sturdy, curvy body.

dialogues.speaker: OROZCO
dialogues.text: I wouldn't fuck you if you were the last bitch on Earth.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Duuude. You did not just say that.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: So Mr. Big Evil. Why do they call you Big Evil?

dialogues.speaker: BIG EVIL
dialogues.text: Because my evil is big.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: You heard it here first, ladies and gentlemen. His evil is big. Can you turn down the music? We had a noise complaint.

dialogues.speaker: BIG EVIL
dialogues.text: Consider it done, officer.

dialogues.speaker: SUPER CARD
dialogues.text: 37 63. INT. HOSPITAL ROOM — DAY 37

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabby in bed, breast-feeding her new baby. Zavala sits next to her, both look content and exhausted. GABBY'S MOM and her brother JOE are also present.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY'S MOM
dialogues.text: Gabby hold his head.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: I am. Mommy, he's fine.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY'S MOM
dialogues.text: Put him in your elbow like this.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: Like a football.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: I can hold a baby. Zavala grins helplessly. Overwhelmed. Then he brightens up and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Partner! Yo! CAMERA PANS -- To find Taylor and Janet entering the room. Taylor sets a vase of flowers on a shelf.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: They're so pretty, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: How's mama doing?

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: Mama's tired and cranky. Just like baby. Mama wants to choke her mama.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY'S MOM
dialogues.text: Gabby.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: You have a lot of hands to help out.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: And a lot of opinions. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: You name him Brian?

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Sorry, bro.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: He's a junior. Named him after his daddy.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: So what's his name?

dialogues.speaker: GABBY'S MOM
dialogues.text: Joe. Be nice, mijo. That's your nephew.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: Can I hold him? A beat. Every new mom is VERY protective. Gabby smiles. Nods: yes. Janet carefully takes the newborn in her arms.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY'S MOM
dialogues.text: See, mija? That's how you hold a baby. Janet gently rocks the baby, cooing and smiling. The infant grabs her nose. She loves kids. Zavala looks at Taylor and grins...

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: You are so done. Taylor looks at Zavala. And knows he's right. INT. BILTMORE HOTEL — GRAND BALLROOM — NIGHT 38

dialogues.speaker: HANDHELD CAMERAS, CELLPHONES, ETC.
dialogues.text: It's the LAPD's annual Medal of Valor Ceremony. Up on the stage are this years recipients -- Ten COPs of all ages and colors looking crisp in their best dress blue uniforms. Taylor and Zavala are among them. Proud, heads held high. The MAYOR of LA reads from their commendation... During his speech we will see various shots of Janet and Gabby in the audience. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Taylor and Zavala on stage looking humbled. Of their BROTHER AND SISTER COPS in the audience. Of the rows of LAPD BRASS and various city BIG SHOTS. Gabby holds their newborn of course, tears in her eyes. Janet too...

dialogues.speaker: L.A. MAYOR
dialogues.text: Officers Brian Taylor and Officer Miguel Zavala were on routine patrol in the six hundred block of Twenty-Sixth street when they saw smoke and flame coming from a fire at a house. A woman exited the house and told the officers that her children were inside. Without waiting for the fire department and without protective equipment, the officers entered the burning structure at great personal risk. The officers, working as a team, rescued the woman's twin sons. Upon exiting the house, they learned that an additional child was inside. They reentered what was now an inferno and feeling their way through the smoke found the woman's daughter and saved the child from certain death. For their selfless actions and exemplary service to the citizens of this city, the department is proud to award Officer Taylor and Officer Zavala the department's highest award; the Medal of Valor. Now the CHIEF OF POLICE hangs medals around the necks of Taylor and Zavala and shakes their whitegloved hands. The two officers return to their place in the line of recipients, verily glowing. Even to the hardest cop it's a great feeling. Gabby can't help it, she screams...

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: We love you, Mike!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zavala drives. With the usual new-father pall of sleeplessness. Taylor doing books. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: You have to sleep. I can't carry you every watch.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Drink more coffee.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: I'm on my ninth Red Bull. We're taking turns feeding, but dang, sometimes the little guy just goes off. Like you heard of colic? That's what they call it when nothing you do makes the kid stop crying. The dude screams so loud I can feel it my soul. Shit is real. I just wanna play football with him and tell him to watch out for skanks already.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Give it a few weeks. You guys will be barhopping together. Then -- A panic filled voice breaks over the radio: ROOKIE V.O. (filtered) Thirteen-Adam-Forty-three! Officer needs help! Zavala and Taylor are immediately hit with an adrenaline rush -- Waiting for her location -- It doesn't come...

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Where! Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: DISPATCH VOICE
dialogues.text: Thirteen-Adam-Forty-three what is your location? ROOKIE V.O. .--I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: That's Van Hauser's car. Just book it South. Go. Go. Zavala flips a U. Guns the engine... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (into mic) Find a street sign and put it out. ROOKIE V.O. (filtered) I don't see any.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Pendeja!

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Can you read a number off a building? A house number?

dialogues.speaker: ROOKIE V.O.
dialogues.text: (filtered) The house says three one seven seven. Then the Rookie SCREAMS -- Her mike cuts off. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Holy shit. Go! Go! Hook down Maple then swing left on Thirty first. (into mic) Thirteen-Adam-Thirteen enroute code three.

dialogues.speaker: DISPATCH
dialogues.text: Thirteen-Adam-Thirteen. Roger. Code three. Zavala makes a hard turn. The ENGINE howls. The SIREN BLARES... Taylor and Zavala scan the side streets looking for Van Hauser's black and white...

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: There! SCREECH! -- Zavala slams the brakes, spinning their car in a 180 -- Then guns it down 3lst. Street... UP AHEAD -- Is Van Hauser's car...

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thirteen-Adam-Thirteen. Code six. Thirty one hundred block of Dorsey Ave. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Taylor unlocks the shotun... Their car slides to a stop and the two cops spring out... EXT. DORSEY AVENUE -— NIGHT 40

dialogues.speaker: WEARABLE CAMERAS.
dialogues.text: Taylor and Zavala run past the car. There sitting on the ground is Van Hauser -- He has a large kitchen knife sticking out of his eye. It's amazing he's still alive.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Don't move, brother. Do not move.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HAUSER
dialogues.text: ..-Hispanic zerohead. Parolee. White T. He's huge...

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: (into radio) Thirteen-Adam-Thirteen. Officer down. Knife wound to the head, conscious and breathing. Request supervisor and an RA. Suspect is a male Hispanic. Shaved head. White T-shirt. Heavyset. On foot, Eastbound through houses, thirty one hundred block, Dorsey Ave. Responding unit take Dorsey and Thirtieth Street. They HEAR the ROOKIE SCREAM... Zavala swings his flashlight... DOWN A DRIVEWAY -- A GIANT FAT CHOLO sits on top of the Korean Rookie punching her in the face over and over... KERCHACK! -- Taylor racks the shotgun...

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Get the fuck off her or I will blow you out of your socks! The ex-con Cholo instantly complies -- He grabs the sky, fingers outstretch. He's had his fun -- As calm as can be... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GIANT FAT CHOLO
dialogues.text: Be cool. I'm done, sir. Be cool. I ain't resisting. I'ma go with you now, officer. WHAM! -- Zavala tackles him. Cuffs him. Searches him.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: (into radio) Thirteen-Adam-Thirteen. Show a Code four. One in custody. Now EVERY SIREN IN THE WORLD blows out the sound as the cavalry has finally arrived... Zavala checks out the Rookie and REACTS -- Her face may never be the same.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: You're safe now. You're safe.

dialogues.speaker: JUMP CUT
dialogues.text: Taylor holding Van Hauser's hand as he is loaded into the ambulance. The knife is taped in place. He is still very lucid...

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: You're going to be okay. We got your back, brother. Whatever you need. The badly wounded salty old cop smiles and croaks:

dialogues.speaker: VAN HAUSER
dialogues.text: ..-thanks...

dialogues.speaker: SARGE
dialogues.text: Taylor!

dialogues.speaker: SARGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Taylor. Hey. Why didn't you blow that asshole away? You had him dead to rights. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Sarge, I didn't feel like killing anyone tonight. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SARGE
dialogues.text: You guys did good. Let's get this written up. Make sure all the logs match. Brass'll need clean paper on this one. DASH CAM SHOT -- Zavala walks up, joins Sarge and Taylor...

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Sarge. You see that shit? Van H had a goddamn Ginsu set in his eye.

dialogues.speaker: SARGE
dialogues.text: He ain't coming back. Split his eyeball. You could see his lens hanging out. Rookie ain't coming back either. Sarge pulls the Rookie's badge from his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: SARGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She gave me this for the Watch Commander. A quiet beat as three veteran cops bathed in the glow of a black and white's headlights ponder the fragile nature of their lives...

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: On today's episode we're rolling to acall. It's just a welfare check. A woman called the station to check on her elderly mother.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: These are the kind of calls that most agencies deal with. Not every call is a foot pursuit or a car chase. There are officers at other places that have never drawn their weapon or been in a gunfight. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Here that's everyday before Code- Seven.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Code seven is lunch for you civilians out there. EXT. WELFARE CHECK HOUSE — DAY 42 Zavala and Taylor at the door. They KNOCK.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Mrs. Williams. Police officers.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Probably didn't change the battery on her hearing aid. JUMP CUT -- Zavala returning to the porch after checking the windows.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: So the daughter is the owner of the house and has given us permission to enter for a welfare check. We're going to boot the door. Zavala cocks back his size ten and -- WHAM! Kicks open the front door.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: When she rolls up from church bingo or the store or whatever and sees the property damage, then we'll be the bad guys. That's when the smell hits them...

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: We got a body. They pull their flashlights and enter the dark house... INT. WELFARE CHECK HOUSE — DAY 43 The vibe is one of danger and foreboding. This is a very bad place to be... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Taylor and Zavala immediately sense something is very wrong. They draw their weapons...

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Policia! Taylor turns down his radio, and they listen a beat. It's dead quiet -- Just the BUZZING of flies. The living room is full of empty beer bottles, holes are punched in the wall. There are extensive gang tags.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Squatters?

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Looks like the eses been kickin' back here. They begin clearing hiding places. Taylor opens a closet...

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Found her. INSIDE THE CLOSET -- Is the corpse of an OLD WOMAN wrapped in plastic and duct tape. Brown liquid pooling inside.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (into radio) Thirteen-Adam-Thirteen. Request supervisor. Possible one eight seven. They move further into the dark old house. Zavala opens a bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Brian. Taylor enters... Inside are several cases of pickled chilies in glass jars from Mexico...

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: This is random. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Taylor unscrews a jar. Pours it out -- A plastic and foil wrapped cylinder falls out. Taylor kneels and cuts it open -- Reveals white crystalline powder...

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dope. They keep moving to clear the final room -- It's door is double padlocked. Zavala gives it the boot... INT. WELFARE CHECK HOUSE — BACK ROOM — NIGHT 44 WHAM! -- The door flies off it's frame and Zavala and Taylor enter... It's a nightmare inside. The room is lined with black plastic. Five bodies in their underwear lay BEHEADED, arms bound behind their back. They men have clearly been tortured... EXT. WELFARE CHECK HOUSE — NIGHT 45 Now surrounded by yellow tape, COP CARS, UNMARKEDS and CORONER'S VANS. We jump into the Channel 7 news story midstream...

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: --one of the largest narcotics seizures in what can only be described as a gruesome discovery. The five bodies were described as showing evidence of torture. A police official familiar with the investigation denied rumors that Mexican Drug Cartels are responsible for the murders. As you can see behind me, FBI and Homeland Security Agents have taken over the crimescene--

dialogues.speaker: CLICK
dialogues.text: EXT. STEVEN'S STEAKHOUSE — NIGHT 46

dialogues.speaker: A NIGHTVISION LENS. 1
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ONLY"
dialogues.text: This is a steak and dinnershow place for monied Mexicans. In a corner of the parking lot, a group of MEXICAN COWBOYS is gathered by a couple horse trailers. OVER WE HEAR -- A subtitled cellphone intercept of two CARTEL MEMBERS speaking Spanish in a Sinaloa drawl...

dialogues.speaker: VOICE 1
dialogues.text: We're having a lot of problems. Many problems. The people South want something done. This is two cops, right? Two regular policemen?

dialogues.speaker: VOICE 2
dialogues.text: Yes. They are policemen.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE 1
dialogues.text: My bosses, the top bosses, want them taken care of.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE 2
dialogues.text: They're police.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE 1
dialogues.text: They are local police. Bad things happen to police all the time. It is a dangerous job.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE 2
dialogues.text: I understand, boss. But it is different here. In Mexico I would take care of tonight.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE 1
dialogues.text: Look. You don't take care of these assholes soon, we both will lose our heads. I am not going to argue with you. If you can't do it, tell me. There are many of us there now.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE 2
dialogues.text: It's okay. Consider them cooked.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE 1
dialogues.text: Okay. Don't leave our prints on this. It has to look routine. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: VOICE 2
dialogues.text: That's no problem. There's lots of crazy people here. People that hate cops. People in gangs.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE 1
dialogues.text: Okay. Take some of the money. Just write down on what you spend it on. Soon. Do it soon.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE 2
dialogues.text: Yes sir. CLICK.

dialogues.speaker: TITLE CARD
dialogues.text: EXT. CASTAWAY'S RESTAURANT -— DAY 47

dialogues.speaker: SOME CELLPHONE AND HANDHELD COVERAGE.
dialogues.text: The wedding gazebo overlooks an epic view of Burbank. Janet is in a traditional gown, Taylor wears crisp dress blues. They stand before their PASTOR...

dialogues.speaker: PASTOR
dialogues.text: You may kiss the bride. Taylor lifts her veil. There are tears in both their eyes. This is a couple that is truly in love... They kiss -- And the crowd goes nuts! NOW WE SEE -- Zavala is his Best Man... There's a few COPS in uniform. A couple MARINES in their iconic blues. Taylor's PARENTS, white haired solid citizens from Ohio. And a strong showing from Janet's EXTENDED IRISH FAMILY... CAMERA FINDS Gabby, holding her baby. The normally tough woman dabs her eyes with a fistful of tissue. INT. RECEPTION HALL — NIGHT 48 The couple has their first dance -- Looking into each other's eyes, smiling. Slowdancing to Lionel Ritchie... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Then the DJ switches it up and BUMPS some Sir Mix-A-Lot. Janet and Taylor break into the routine they've been working on. Lot's of spins, dips and choreographed hip hop moves. Utterly hilarious... Now Janet and Taylor cut the cake. They end up smearing cake on each other's faces... It's time for the toast. Zavala stands before the newlyweds. He's already a little in the bag...

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: I've known Brian since the academy. He helped me with the coursework. And I helped harden him up so he could pass PT. I don't really like cops. Maybe ‘cause of where I grew up. But Brian was cool so I figured we should work patrol together. You sit in a car with the same dude watch after watch and you know them. And the second I saw him with Janet, I'm like that's it. She's his lady. So I'm not surprised to be here. Just that it took so long. And Janet, you got a lot of heart hooking up with acop. You gotta be a strong person. I see a lot of cops' wives here and they're all nodding their heads. We're all hoping that you can make a man out of Brian because we've given up. (to Brian) Don't give me that look. Brother, you take care of her. ‘Cause I'm her big brother now. All these cops in here. We're her family now too. Okay. Let's drink already. I'm tired of holding this glass up. To Brian and Janet. Cheers.

dialogues.speaker: EVERYONE
dialogues.text: Cheers. LATER -- The boys are huddled for shots of tequila. Orozco is there in a pretty dress. The Sarge. Other NEWTON COPS we recognize. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Orozco, I didn't know you were pretty.

dialogues.speaker: SARGE
dialogues.text: That statement could be misconstrued.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: By who? Orozco's the mean ass ugly big sister who shoots people I never had.

dialogues.speaker: OROZCO
dialogues.text: Sarge, it's Taylor's reception. Put the badge away.

dialogues.speaker: SARGE
dialogues.text: Okay. Sorry. Zavala pours everyone shots of Patron. The knot of Cops, two Marines Taylor served with, hold up their glasses.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Why'd you get married in uniform, bro? If you worked at Best Buy would you wear the stupid polo shirt?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Hell yes. I'm representing. You know I love you.

dialogues.speaker: OROZCO
dialogues.text: Here they go.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: I love you too, brother.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Serious. I'd lay down my life for you.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: I'd take a bullet for you, homie.

dialogues.speaker: SARGE
dialogues.text: Why didn't you two get married? Closer than girlfriends.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Okay-okay-okay. Everyone just shut up and take a shot. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Salud, bitch!

dialogues.speaker: EVERYONE
dialogues.text: Salud! They down the shots. LATER -- Music BUMPS, people dance. Taylor and Janet and Zavala and Gabby sit at a table, relaxed, content.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: Marriage is pretty basic. You gotta give it up all the time. Girls throw it at cops. Don't give him a reason, sweetheart.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Gabby.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: And you got to be a freak, girl. Try new things.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: You're cut off. Orozco comes running up with a worried expression...

dialogues.speaker: OROZCO
dialogues.text: Hey. Sarge is hell'a faded and crying about his partner that got shot back in the day and his wife wants him to go home. We gotta get him in the car.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: Go help your boss. Zavala gets up, follows Orozco.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: Do you ever get jealous? Of the female officers?

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: Cops or not. Any of those bitches touch my man I will kill them. Straight up.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: She will too. You down for a one eight seven? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: I'll leave you wondering on that one. EXT. GRAND CANYON — DAY 49 On honeymoon, Taylor stands on the edge of the majestic canyon at sunset, the orange and purple colors of the canyon wall are intoxicating. HE SMILES AT CAMERA, which Janet holds, a big genuine in-love smile...

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: I thought I was happy. But I never thought I could be this happy. Didn't know it was possible. You're like life on crack.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: Oh, God. On crack?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: It's a saying. Slip me some tongue.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: (laughing) Who are you? I married such a nice young man?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: You married a ghetto street cop. They embrace and kiss, CAMERA between them, looking straight up as they kiss...

dialogues.speaker: LINOTE
dialogues.text: Zavala checks a text message. Taylor waves at a HOMELESS MAN pushing a cart.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Gabby wants to know if you and Janet wanna go to the Dodgers game with us tonight.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: We're going to Santa Barbara. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Fuck you then. Mr. Tre comes running up to their car in a bathrobe.

dialogues.speaker: MR. TRE
dialogues.text: Yo. Officers.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: What's up, Tre?

dialogues.speaker: MR. TRE
dialogues.text: Word's going around the eses put a green light on y'all.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: That's what's going around?

dialogues.speaker: MR. TRE
dialogues.text: Yep. My roaddog just got outta the pen. Heard it up North.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: You sure it's us?

dialogues.speaker: MR. TRE
dialogues.text: Taylor and Zavala. That's you ain't it? Zavala checks his nametag.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Yep. Thanks for the heads up. Don't mean you get a pass if we catch you slipping.

dialogues.speaker: MR. TRE
dialogues.text: I know. Watch y'alls backs. Zavala and Taylor. When they get a distance away the grin at each other and tap fists.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Hell yeah.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: You know we're making a difference if we're pissing people off that much.  51 81.

dialogues.speaker: NOT
dialogues.text: La La drives. She's switched up her appearance -- She looks like any other Latina mom in the neighborhood. In back are Big Evil, Wicked and Demon holding the camera. The guys have bandanas covering their faces. Wicked hefts a shotgun. CAMERA PANS -- To reveal they are following an LAPD black and white.

dialogues.speaker: BIG EVIL
dialogues.text: Tap their bumper at the stop sign. And we'll jump out and blast.

dialogues.speaker: LA LA
dialogues.text: No. Let's get 'em then they go to lunch. At that Chinese place.

dialogues.speaker: BIG EVIL
dialogues.text: There's a gang'a cops there all the time. They gotta be alone.

dialogues.speaker: LA LA
dialogues.text: We can follow their asses home.

dialogues.speaker: BIG EVIL
dialogues.text: Mira, homegirl. The whiteboy lives in Simi Valley. The other fool's in San Gabriel. We gotta hit the fuckers at the same time.

dialogues.speaker: DEMON
dialogues.text: This is the one-time, homie. Not a bunch'a niggers. Why we doing this shit?

dialogues.speaker: BIG EVIL
dialogues.text: This wire's straight from the SHU, homie. You got in the car. Now pay the ticket for all the good times. Price of fucking admission, ese.

dialogues.speaker: LA LA
dialogues.text: This is fucking stupid. Those fools got bullet proof vests. We need AKs and shit. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BIG EVIL
dialogues.text: Don't rank out, La La.

dialogues.speaker: LA LA
dialogues.text: Fuck you. When the fuck have I ever backed down from shit, huh? I'm saying we can't fuck this up. I don't give a fuck, I'll do the time. But I don't want the big homies whacking me for fucking up. We need a plan. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: WICKED
dialogues.text: The homegirl's right, ese.

dialogues.speaker: BIG EVIL
dialogues.text: Fuck it. Head back. La La makes a right... CAMERA STAYS on the black and white as it continues up the street. Oblivious to the danger it was in... INT. NEWTON DIVISION — ROLL CALL ROOM — DAY 52

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taylor is up to something sneaky. He tries not to laugh as he says this AT CAMERA:

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Never fall asleep in a room full of cops. He PANS ONTO Zavala who then tickles the nose of a SLEEPING COP with a pencil... The Sleeping Cop scratches his nose -- With a hand full of SHAVING CREAM. (Yep, it's the old Summercamp trick.) He startles awake. Looks around angrily. The DOZEN COPS in the room CRACK UP...

dialogues.speaker: SLEEPING COP
dialogues.text: Zavala, that's really professional behavior. Just ‘cause you won the medal doesn't give you a license to be a prick. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Not only did the prank work but the victim is extra upset. That gets Taylor and Zavala bonus points. The dozen COPS clap their approval. The Sleeping Cop gets up angrily and exits -- Right as Sarge enters. He instantly figures out what's going on. Points angrily at Taylor and Zavala...

dialogues.speaker: SARGE
dialogues.text: Keep it up, you two. That kind of shit will earn you a risk Management case. The department built you up, wanna see how quickly it can tear you down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taylor and Zavala on regular patrol.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: How was Santa Barbara?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Awesome. Janet's pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Get outta here. Already? Dang, bro. She ain't even Mexican.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: She's getting the ultrasound tomorrow to confirm, but three of those test things were positive. Zavala shakes Taylor's hand.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Congrats, man. Wouldn't it be crazy if our kids were pushing a black and white together one day?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Screw that. I want my kid to have an honest job. Like a politician. We may not have noticed -- But they've been following a MINIVAN. It pulls alongside. Then... The minivan runs a light -- Narrowly missing a truck. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: What an idiot. Blowing a light in front of a cop.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: That's contempt. Light ‘em up. Zavala guns the engine and follow the minivan...

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: He's running.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: (into mic) Thirteen-Adam-Thirteen. We're following a vehicle failing to yield at a high rate of speed. Eastbound on Adams. Four Boy Edward X-Ray nine one five. Grey Toyota minivan. Request back-up. They follow the minivan around the corner. It's speeding into an area of closely packed residential streets...

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (into mic) Thirteen-Adam-Thirteen. We're in pursuit Southbound on Hooper from Adams. The Minivan makes a surprise left onto a dead end street. Zavala stays on its bumper.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: They're gonna bail. Sure enough the minivan SCREECHES to a stop in front of an apartment building -- The driver -- A YOUNG HOMEBOY...

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: (into mic) Thirteen-Adam-Thirteen. Foot pursuit. Southbound from Twenty five hundred Hooper Place. Male Hispanic. Dark clothing. Taylor and Zavala give chase -- The Young Homeboy runs into an apartment building... A foreboding dark building -- With barred windows... If your stomach isn't tied in a knot it should be...  54 85. INT. APARTMENT BUILDING — NIGHT 54 Taylor and Zavala enter the MAIN GATE -- Then follow the hall that leads to the open courtyard... BEHIND THEM -- They hear the steel gate SLAM CLOSED... They enter the courtyard of the three story building -- Open walkways surround the courtyard...

dialogues.speaker: 47, TAKING AIM AT THE COPS BELOW...
dialogues.text: -- It's an ambush! -- Taylor's alarm bells go off -- He grabs Zavala and throws him against a wall right as... BRDDDDT! -- BRDDDDDT! -- THREE AKs open up from the shadows of the walkways above... Rounds CRASH into the stucco wall and cement patio raising huge clouds of dust... Taylor screams into his radio--

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Thirteen-Adam-Thirteen. Shots fired officer needs-- WHACK! -- The radio is shot out of his hand. ON CHOLOCAM -- La La hisses at Demon...

dialogues.speaker: LA LA
dialogues.text: You missed stupid. BAM-BAM-BAM-BAM! -- Zavala returns fire at the MUZZLE FLASHES of an AK on a walkway above... It's suddenly quiet -- The cops can HEAR the ominous sound of AK's being reloaded... Taylor's hand is bleeding.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: I'm hit. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Let's go. They're reloading. They get up and run like panicked cats -- This is unfamiliar real estate... They find an apartment unit without the ubiquitous steel door... WHAM! -- Zavala kicks it open and they rush inside... INT. APARTMENT UNIT — NIGHT 55 A scared YOUNG MOTHER hugs her BABY in the blue glow of a TV. They run her past looking for the back door out...

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: No dice. We're trapped. Taylor pulls out his cellphone...

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shit. I got no bars. You call dispatch.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: My phone's in the car. (to the Young Mother) Dame tu telephone. She hands Zavala her cellphone. Zavala dials as Taylor covers the door...

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Senora. Bajase al suelo, por favor. The Young Mother takes his advise and lays down on the floor... Right then... BRDDDDT-BRDDDT-BRDDDDDDDDT! -- A fusillade of AK fire rips into the apartment... Zavala hurls himself to the ground... Taylor too... AK rounds are punching through walls, shattering picture frames. Incredible dust and noise... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The DISPATCHER answers. We HEAR the recorded call from the LAPD Dispatch archives...

dialogues.speaker: DISPATCH VOICE
dialogues.text: Communications.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: (into cellphone) This is Thirteen-Adam-Thirty. Officer needs help. Multiple suspects with automatic weapons. We are barricaded in an apartment building. (to the Young Mother) Dime la direccion.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MOTHER
dialogues.text: Venti-cinco venti-dos. Departamento C.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: (into cellphone) Twenty-five twenty-two Hooper place Apartment C. EXT. APARTMENT BUILDING — NIGHT 56 ON CHOLOCAM -- Big Evil WHISTLES at Demon.

dialogues.speaker: BIG EVIL
dialogues.text: Eh, fool. Can they get out?

dialogues.speaker: DEMON
dialogues.text: No, homie. We got ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: BIG EVIL
dialogues.text: Go down. Go down. Wicked, bust some caps on ‘em while the homeboys move up. CHOLOCAM FINDS WICKED -- He aims at the apartment unit and squeezes off a couple shots... The other Homies head for the stairwells... La La (filming) spins the CAMERA ON HERSELF. Grinning...

dialogues.speaker: LA LA
dialogues.text: We so got these fools.  57 88. INT. APARTMENT UNIT -— NIGHT 57 Zavala looks relieved.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: We're good. Dispatch put it out. They're sending the cavalry. Rolling SWAT, airships the World. POW-POW! -- A couple AK rounds ZIP through the apartment. Taylor looking decidedly worried. Zavala SEES that...

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Partner?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Wasn't Big Evil in the Army?

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: They're moving. If they assault we can't hold them off. We have to lay down a base of fire and pivot.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: I wasn't a Marine. The fuck's that mean in cop?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: We're shooting our way out.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Senora, no hay salida por alli?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MOTHER
dialogues.text: Si. A la izquierda. Hay una puerta que sale al parking.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: There's a door to the parking on the left.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Shooter's on the second story. On three empty your mag and run. Zavala and Taylor get ready... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: One. Two. Three! Zavala and Taylor charge out firing-- EXT. APARTMENT BUILDING — CONTINUOUS - NIGHT 58

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POP-POP-POP-POP-POP-POP-POP! -- They hook left and race towards a big grey door... BRDDDDDDDT -- Wicked opens up... AK ROUNDS splatter all over the place...

dialogues.speaker: WICKED
dialogues.text: They're getting away! Zavala reaches the door. Yanks it open and darts in, holding it open for Taylor-- --Who dives like he's sliding into first base... CHOLOCAM -- Big Evil, Demon and La La reach the apartment unit -- But they are too late... EXT. APARTMENT BUILDING — PARKING LOT - NIGHT 59

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taylor and Zavala running, they both reload -- They SEE A CAR with the engine running -- A CHOLO inside... He raises a shotqun... Taylor and Zavala open fire -- Punching holes in the windows, killing the Cholo...

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: ..-they're everywhere...

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Keep going.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Where's the cavalry? They exit the parking lot -- It leads to... EXT. LONG ALLEY — NIGHT 60 It_is the most foreboding alley in South Central... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Littered with trash, abandoned furniture, spiked steel fences and corrugated tin. Dogs BARKING everywhere... There is only one thing to do and that's to keep running... Taylor and Zavala run for their lives...

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Partner?

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: This sucks.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: I think we killed that guy.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Good. They can HEAR sirens approaching...

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Hear that?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: God yes. Fucking music. HEADLIGHTS -- A vehicle enters the far end of the alley and turns towards them. Blinding headlights...

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: That us? That PD? The vehicle accelerates RACES TOWARDS them... Closing the distance -- COMING RIGHT AT THEM! Zavala opens fire -- POP-POP-POP-POP! Zavala and Taylor jump out of the way as the vehicle plows into a dumpster... It's a pick-up truck -- A HOMIE with an AK sits in the bed... BRDDDDT! -- He opens fire... POP-POP-POP! -- Zavala shoots him in the head, he drops limp. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The pick-up truck gets the hell out of there...

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I lit that asshole up. No response... Zavala turns SEES Taylor is on the ground, he's taken three AK rounds to the chest. He's gasping for breath...

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Brian! Fuck! Oh, fuck! Oh, God. He kneels by his partners side. Inspects his wounds.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: It's bad isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: It's bad. But I've seen guys way more fucked up make it.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: I'm going to die.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Shut-up. Zavala looking around. Desperate, worried...

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where the fuck is everybody? Taylor begins shaking.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: I love Janet so much.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: I know you do.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: No. I love her so much. It hurts so much I love her. I don't want to lose her. Taylor's eyes roll back. He begins convulsing...

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Shit-shit-shit. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Zavala feels his pulse fading -- He unzips his shirt and un-velcros his vest -- Initiates CPR, giving him chest compressions...

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hold on. Hang on partner! CHOLOCAM -- Approaching Zavala as he gives CPR to Taylor. Following Big Evil and Demon... A shadow falls over him...

dialogues.speaker: DEMON
dialogues.text: Wassup puto? Zavala's stomach drops. He turns -- SEES Demon and Big Evil aiming an AK at his face, La La behind them filming it... Zavala has to try. He can't just give up -- He grabs for his holstered Glock... BRDDDDDT! -- Zavala is no more. His body collapses atop Taylor... A peal of EVIL LAUGHTER from the Cholos as they get the Hell out of there...

dialogues.speaker: FAR END OF THE ALLEY...
dialogues.text: SIRENS GROWING LOUDER -- Now very Close... A LOUD HELICOPTER approaching... Many more LOUD SIRENS -- Every cop in the city must be on the way... A COP CAR races into the alley -- Blue and red lights flashing. Then another cop car... It SCREECHES to a stop -- Its headlight BLINDING CAMERA...

dialogues.speaker: LAPD PILOT VOICE
dialogues.text: Los Angeles Police Department! Drop the weapons! CHOLOCAM -- Following Demon, Wicked and Big Evil... La La and her homies exit the alley and run right into... A PHALANX OF COPS with raised pistols and shotguns... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Demon raises his AK... THE COPS OPEN FIRE AT CAMERA -- A CRESCENDO OF GUNFIRE... The Gangsters are hit with a hail of gunfire... The CAMERA POV falls to the ground. La La's dead face lands next to it FILLING FRAME... La_La, Big Evil, Demon and Wicked are no more. EXT. SOUTH CENTRAL L.A. — ALLEY — NIGHT 61 A COP approaches ZAVALA'S CAMERA -- It's Orozco. She falls to her knees and sobs...

dialogues.speaker: CHANNEL 7 NEWS FOOTAGE... 62
dialogues.text: The BREAKING NEWS graphic -- The anchors, MARK and MICHELLE, in the newsroom with somber faces...

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: Breaking news tonight out of LAPD's Newton Division. Two officers have been killed tonight after an encounter with gang members armed with AK-47 assault rifles.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. LA POLICE ACADEMY — DAY 63

dialogues.speaker: PAGEANTRY OF A LAW ENFORCEMENT MEMORIAL.
dialogues.text: Gabby in a black mourning dress and veil holds her baby in her lap. Next to her is Janet, noticeably pregnant. The CHIEF hands Gabby a folded flag -- Her baby reaches out and touches the Chief's badge... LATER -- The LAPD HONOR GUARD fires the traditional volley in honor of the fallen...  64 65 94. EXT. DOWNTOWN LOS ANGELES — DAY 64 BAGPIPERS play AMAZING GRACE... Two riderless horses pull wagons each with a flag draped coffin are lead by EQUESTRIAN OFFICERS in stetson hats... A HUNDRED MOTORCYCLE OFFICERS from agencies all over Southern California pass in revue... Pallbearers in LAPD uniform carry two flag draped coffins into Our Lady of Angels Cathedral...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zavala drives. Taylor keeps books. This is just two hours before they were killed...

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: If your kid was a girl, would you let her be a cop?

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Would I want my daughter packing a burner to protect herself from the assholes of the World? Hell yeah.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: We're having a daughter.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Just don't let her date cops.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: She's not dating anyone. Ever.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: I ever tell you about the first time I spent the night with Gabby?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: I don't want to hear that.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: I got a hella-big family. Someone's always in my house. And I had no money for a motel. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: One time Gabby's parents bounced to Ensenada and her brother crashed at his girlfriends so I spend the night at her house. This was gonna be the night. The night. Know what I'm saying?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: So we're in her parent's bed. And it's on. It's about to go down. I'm pulling her chones off--

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: --chones?

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Her skivvies, dog. And I'm like finally, right? Fucking finally. But we hear this noise. Like someone's in the pad. We figure it's her brother so I hide under the bed. Dude. It was her parents. This is the second floor. I got nowhere to go. Homegirl tries to distract them but it ain't happening. I'm under their bed. And they crash. And this is the part I never told Gabby. They did it. They got down. I'm talking Gabby's parents. That shit was traumatic. Finally at like two A.M. they fall asleep. So I do a commando crawl and escape. Zavala can barely contain his laughter...

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Must of been a little uncomfortable around the folks after that.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Bro. Her old man is a freak. Straight up. I guess you been married that long you gotta mix it up. (a beat) (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I try and roll like that and Gabby gets all "Hell no, you ain't touching me there."

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: I'm starting to get uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Cause you're a freak too, huh?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Don't go there.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: She said on our tenth anniversary it's all good. We'll get down.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: I'm telling her everything you just told me.

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: That's against the rules.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: You done then?

dialogues.speaker: ZAVALA
dialogues.text: Yeah. Don't trip.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Let's go fight crime or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A STILL PHOTO FADES IN: Taylor and Janet at the Grand Canyon, all smiles in happier time... The photo fades out. Black screen. Then another title: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: END OF WATCH AUGUST 17, 2011
dialogues.text: FADE IN ANOTHER STILL PHOTO: Zavala in the hospital room holding his newborn boy. He looks like the proudest dad on Earth. NEXT ANOTHER PHOTO: Taylor and Zavala at their academy graduation -- The faces of the two freshly minted cops glow just as bright as the new badges on their chests... A FINAL PHOTO: From Taylor's wedding -- A three shot of Sarge, Taylor and Zavala...

dialogues.speaker: SUPER TITLE
dialogues.text: In memory of Brian Taylor and Mike Zavala two of the best cops I have ever had the honor to work with. IF YOU HAVEN'T FIGURED IT OUT, SARGE EDITED THIS TRIBUTE. We PUSH IN on the photo for a beat. Then...

dialogues.speaker: FADE TO BLACK
dialogues.text: The End
